definition: in the ordinary course of events/ordinarily/normally
to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Ordinarily it should be snowing at this time of the year.
Ordinarily they were able to rack up all the other teams without the lightest effort.
sentences.chinese: 按說他們可以毫不費勁地擊敗其他各隊。

sentences.english: Ordinarily, you want to trade all the time.
sentences.chinese: 按說，你想要的一切貿易。

sentences.english: Tell truth , Ordinarily my life should be very pleased .
sentences.chinese: 說實話，按說我的生活應該過得很愜意。

sentences.english: It is thought that whoever she crowns will be the next to wed.
sentences.chinese: 按說，獲得金冠的女子就是下一個要結婚的人。

sentences.english: They should be at the airport by now.
sentences.chinese: 按說他們現在應當已經到機場了。

sentences.english: "Don't fight the People's Bank" says that's the right strategy now.
sentences.chinese: “別和人民銀行作對”按說是目前的良策。
